summary: Edward M. Evans was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list his name, social security number (in one instance), annual salary, and gross pay for the specified periods. The documents indicate he was employed by the committee for a significant portion of its operational timeline.
significance: Edward M. Evans' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation, though the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents.
